div.p: SALVATION, means the ſafety or preſervation of any thing which is or has been in danger, and is generally uſed in a religious ſenſe, when it means preſervation from eternal death, or reception to the happineſs of heaven, which is now offered to all men by the Chriſtian religion upon certain conditions. The Hebrews but rarely make uſe of concrete terms as they are called, but often of abſtracted. Thus, inſtead of faying that God ſaves them and protects them, they ſay that God is their ſalvation. Thus the word of ſalvation, the joy of ſalvation, the rock of ſalvation, the ſhield of ſalvation, the horn of ſalvation, &c . is as much as to ſay, The word that declares deliverance; the joy that attends the eſcaping a great danger, a rock where any one takes refuge, and where he may be in ſafety from his enemy; a buckler, that ſecures him from the arm of the enemy; a horn or ray of light, of happineſs and ſalvation, &c. See Theology, &c.
